revised_title: Conductivity of Lattices of Spheres: The Simple Cubic Lattice
tldr: The authors extended Lord Rayleigh's method to calculate the conductivity of a simple cubic lattice of conducting spheres in a conducting matrix, taking into account the effects of multipoles of arbitrarily high order. The study provides an explicit formula for the conductivity and compares it with measurements on arrays of perfectly conducting spheres, even when they are close to touching.
